text:
CURRENT STATUS AI.D LONG-RANGE PLANS FOR EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION IN FLORIDA
Florida has five (5) VHF stations on the air: ("Interconnected" into a
"network" by exchange of
Channel 2, WTHS, Miami video-taped credit courses.)
Channel 3, WEDU, Tampa- Jt.Petersburg
Channel 5, WUFT, Gainesville
Channel 7, WJCT, Jacksonville
Channel 11, WFSU-TV, Tallahassee
(Other channels reserved for education in Florida, but not yet activated:
Channel 15, West Palm Beach
Channel 21, Pensacola
Channel 24, Orlando
Channel 30, panama City
Florida Educational Television Commission has filed petition with FCC
requesting following allocations and reservation* for education:
Channel 14, Cocoa
Channel 15, Ocala
Channel 16, Fort Myers
Channel 17, Marianna
Channel 17, Palatka
Channel Id, New Smyrna Beach
Channel 21, Madison
Channel 25, Boca Raton
Channel 26, Leesburg
Channel 2d, Bradenton
Channel 31, Fort Pierce
Channel 33, Lake City
The Florida Commission is also currently having petition prepared
to request the Federal Communications Commission to;
Drop-in Channel 11, Orlando, and reserve for education*
James Etheridge, Jr.
Executive Secretary
Florida ETT Conniesica
Knott Bldg.,Tallahassee
